scripts.comment: A few example usages of the block are shown below!
Once you have the block working, check out the example program using it below (and on the sprite's code)! Can you finish the code in the Sprite to detect winning and losing?

Given a minesweeper board with empty spaces and mine locations, can you add the missing numbers to the board? As a refresher, minesweeper is a game in which there is a grid where each location contains either - a mine or - a number representing the number of mines in the 8 surrounding tiles The user does not know where the mines are on the grid and must select locations to check (at which point the value of the location is shown). If the user selects a mine they lose. If they select all non-mine locations, they win! In this activity, we are simply adding the numbers to a minesweeper board with mines. For example, adding the mine counts to the following board below (left) should result in the board to its right. Edit the blocks to the left to get started!
Switch to the stage to view the problem!

block-definition.translations: de:Kostüm aus Text _ Größe _ pt:um traje com o texto _ de tamanho _

<comment collabId="item_838" x="84.66666666666667" y="49.22222222222221" w="90" collapsed="false">add comment here...</comment>
Switch to the stage to view the problem!

Given a minesweeper board with empty spaces and mine locations, can you add the missing numbers to the board?
As a refresher, minesweeper is a game in which there is a grid where each location contains either
- a mine or
- a number representing the number of mines in the 8 surrounding tiles
The user does not know where the mines are on the grid and must select locations to check (at which point the value of the location is shown). If the user selects a mine they lose. If they select all non-mine locations, they win!
In this activity, we are simply adding the numbers to a minesweeper board with mines. For example, adding the mine counts to the following board:
_ * _
*_ _
* _ _
should result in
2 * 1
* 3 1
* 2 0
Open the custom blocks on the left to view the problem!

Given a minesweeper board with empty spaces and mine locations, can you add the missing numbers to the board? As a refresher, minesweeper is a game in which there is a grid where each location contains either - a mine or - a number representing the number of mines in the 8 surrounding tiles
The user does not know where the mines are on the grid and must select locations to check (at which point the value of the location is shown). If the user selects a mine they lose. If they select all non-mine locations, they win!
In this activity, we are simply adding the numbers to a minesweeper board with mines. For example, adding the mine counts to the following board below (left) should result in the board to its right.
